alert.note: Alert for Brown; Day; Marshall; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 12 at 5:28PM MDT until May 12 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: The National Weather Service in Aberdeen has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Roberts County in northeastern South Dakota... Northern Day County in northeastern South Dakota... Marshall County in northeastern South Dakota... Northeastern Brown County in northeastern South Dakota... * Until 715 PM CDT. * At 628 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Putney to Rudebusch Corner, moving north at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Houghton and Buffalo Lakes around 640 PM CDT. Sand Lake Wildlife Refuge around 645 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Hecla and Sica Hollow State Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern South Dakota. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern South Dakota.
